name: SBOM-uClibc-httpd
description: References to uClibc components were found in the httpd binary, version unknown. The evidence source is the dynamic linker reference '/lib/ld-uClibc.so.0'. Further analysis is required to determine the uClibc version.
notes: Further analysis of the uClibc version is required; it is recommended to check version information in other files.

name: SBOM-GCC-httpd
description: The GCC compiler version strings found in the httpd binary: 'GCC: (GNU) 3.3.2' and 'GCC: (GNU) 4.3.3', indicating the code may have been compiled with different compiler versions.
notes: Search for CVEs related to GCC 3.3.2 and 4.3.3.

name: SBOM-libxml-httpd
description: A reference to the libxml component was found in the httpd binary file, with an unknown version. The evidence source is the dynamic library reference 'libxml.so'.
notes: Further analysis of the libxml version is required

name: SBOM-libpthread-httpd
description: The reference to the libpthread component found in the httpd binary is version 0 of the uClibc variant. The evidence source is the dynamic library reference 'libpthread.so.0'.

name: SBOM-librt-httpd
description: The reference to the librt component found in the httpd binary is version 0 of the uClibc variant. The source of evidence is the dynamic library reference 'librt.so.0'.

name: SBOM-httpd-custom
description: Analysis of the httpd binary reveals it to be a custom implementation rather than a known web server. It links multiple proprietary libraries (libcutil.so, libos.so, libcmm.so), which appear to be custom-developed.
notes: Further analysis is required regarding the functionality and potential risks of these custom libraries.

name: SBOM-uClibc-0.9.30.1
description: By analyzing the files in the lib directory, it was confirmed that the uClibc version is 0.9.30.1. The evidence sources are the filenames 'ld-uClibc-0.9.30.1.so' and 'libuClibc-0.9.30.1.so'.
notes: Query known CVE vulnerabilities for uClibc version 0.9.30.1

name: SBOM-OpenSSL-0.9.7
description: By analyzing the files in the lib directory, it was confirmed that the OpenSSL version is 0.9.7. The evidence sources are the filenames 'libcrypto.so.0.9.7' and 'libssl.so.0.9.7'.
notes: OpenSSL 0.9.7 is a very old version that may contain multiple high-risk vulnerabilities, requiring immediate checking of relevant CVEs.

name: SBOM-GCC-4.3.3-confirmed
description: Verify GCC compiler version 4.3.3. The evidence source is the string 'GCC: (GNU) 4.3.3'.
notes: Query known CVE vulnerabilities for GCC 4.3.3

name: SBOM-iptables-unknown
description: The iptables component was detected but the version was not specified. The evidence source is the module file 'ipt_STAT.ko'.
notes: Further analysis of the iptables version information is required.

name: SBOM-UPnP-unknown
description: UPnP library found but version not specified. Evidence sourced from dynamic library 'libupnp.so'.
notes: Further analysis of UPnP library version information is required

name: SBOM-libupnp-1.6.6
description: Confirm that the version of the Portable SDK for UPnP devices (libupnp) is 1.6.6. The evidence source is the string 'Portable SDK for UPnP devices/1.6.6' in the lib/libupnp.so file. This version contains multiple high-risk vulnerabilities.
notes: Version 1.6.6 (released in 2013) contains multiple known critical vulnerabilities, particularly buffer overflow vulnerabilities (CVE-2016-8863, CVE-2012-5958, etc.).

name: SBOM-KCodes-NetUSB-module
description: The KCodes NetUSB kernel module, identified in lib/modules/GPL_NetUSB.ko with version information Linux 2.6.32.32, contains multiple critical vulnerabilities, including remote code execution and information disclosure flaws.
notes: It is recommended to inspect all devices utilizing the KCodes NetUSB module and apply relevant patches as soon as possible.

name: SBOM-BusyBox-1.19.2
description: The BusyBox component found in bin/busybox, version 1.19.2. No directly related CVE vulnerabilities have been identified at this time.
notes: Further verification is required for the CVE status of BusyBox 1.19.2.

name: SBOM-ntfs-3g-83.0.0
description: The ntfs-3g component found in lib/libntfs-3g.so.83.0.0, version 83.0.0. Further CVE query is required.
notes: Query CVE vulnerabilities for ntfs-3g version 83.0.0

name: SBOM-Linux-kernel-modules
description: Linux kernel module found in the lib/modules directory, version unspecified. Further analysis required.
notes: Check /proc/version to obtain kernel version information

name: SBOM-BusyBox-1.19.2-updated
description: The BusyBox core component found in bin/busybox, version 1.19.2 (released in 2015). Provides /sbin/init functionality, no known public CVE records identified but the version is outdated.
notes: As a core component, it is recommended to check for security update versions

name: SBOM-uClibc-0.9.30.1-updated
description: uClibc version 0.9.30.1 component, no specific CVE records found in NVD.
notes: Consider replacing with a newer version of libraries such as glibc or musl.

name: SBOM-OpenSSL-0.9.7f-critical
description: OpenSSL 0.9.7f (released in 2005) contains multiple critical vulnerabilities, including remote code execution risks.
